intro: Frithia humilis, commonly known as the dwarf frithia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Its foliage consists of strap-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Frithia humilis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
